s0021.literal: In the third month, the army disbanded.
s0021.idiomatic: In the third month, the army disbanded.

s0022.chinese: 秦質子歸自趙，趙太子出歸國。
s0022.literal: The Qin hostage returned from Zhao, and the Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state.
s0022.idiomatic: The Qin hostage returned from Zhao, and the Zhao crown prince went out and returned to his state.

s0023.chinese: 十月庚寅，蝗蟲從東方來，蔽天。
s0023.literal: On the gengyin day of the tenth month, locusts came from the east and covered the sky.
s0023.idiomatic: On the gengyin day of the tenth month, locusts came from the east and covered the sky.

s0024.literal: There was plague throughout the land.
s0024.idiomatic: There was plague throughout the land.

s0025.chinese: 百姓內粟千石，拜爵一級。
s0025.literal: Commoners who contributed a thousand shi of grain were granted one rank of nobility.
s0025.idiomatic: Commoners who contributed a thousand shi of grain were granted one rank of nobility.

s0026.chinese: 五年，將軍驁攻魏，定酸棗、燕、虛、長平、雍丘、山陽城，皆拔之，取二十城。
s0026.literal: In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang, captured them all, and took twenty cities.
s0026.idiomatic: In the fifth year, General Ao attacked Wei, pacified Suanzao, Yan, Xu, Changping, Yongqiu, and Shanyang, captured them all, and took twenty cities.

s0029.chinese: 六年，韓、魏、趙、衛、楚共擊秦，取壽陵。
s0029.literal: In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu jointly attacked Qin and took Shouling.
s0029.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Han, Wei, Zhao, Wei, and Chu jointly attacked Qin and took Shouling.

s0030.literal: Qin deployed troops, and the five states' armies disbanded.
s0030.idiomatic: Qin deployed troops, and the five states' armies disbanded.

s0031.chinese: 拔衛，迫東郡，其君角率其支屬徙居野王，阻其山以保魏之河內。
s0031.literal: They captured Wei, pressed upon Dongjun; its lord Jiao led his kinsmen to relocate to Yewang, blocked off the mountains to protect Wei's Henei.
s0031.idiomatic: They captured Wei, pressed upon Dongjun; its lord Jiao led his kinsmen to relocate to Yewang, blocked off the mountains to protect Wei's Henei.

s0032.chinese: 七年，彗星先出東方，見北方，五月見西方。
s0032.literal: In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west.
s0032.idiomatic: In the seventh year, a comet first appeared in the east, was seen in the north, and in the fifth month was seen in the west.

s0034.chinese: 以攻龍、孤、慶都，還兵攻汲。
s0034.literal: Troops attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned to attack Ji.
s0034.idiomatic: Troops attacked Long, Gu, and Qingdu, then returned to attack Ji.

s0035.literal: The comet appeared again in the west for sixteen days.
s0035.idiomatic: The comet appeared again in the west for sixteen days.

s0037.chinese: 八年，王弟長安君成蟜將軍擊趙，反，死屯留，軍吏皆斬死，遷其民於臨洮。
s0037.literal: In the eighth year, the king's younger brother, Lord Chang'an Chengjiao, as general attacked Zhao, rebelled, and died at Tunliu; all military officers were beheaded and executed, and their people were relocated to Lintao.
s0037.idiomatic: In the eighth year, the king's younger brother, Lord Chang'an Chengjiao, as general attacked Zhao, rebelled, and died at Tunliu; all military officers were beheaded and executed, and their people were relocated to Lintao.

s0038.chinese: 將軍壁死，卒屯留、蒲鶴反，戮其尸。
s0038.literal: General Bi died; the troops of Tunliu and Puhe rebelled; his corpse was mutilated.
s0038.idiomatic: General Bi died; the troops of Tunliu and Puhe rebelled; his corpse was mutilated.

s0039.chinese: 河魚大上，輕車重馬東就食。
s0039.literal: River fish swarmed upstream; light chariots and heavy horses went east to find food.
s0039.idiomatic: River fish swarmed upstream; light chariots and heavy horses went east to find food.

s0040.literal: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Marquis Changxin.
s0040.idiomatic: Lao Ai was enfeoffed as Marquis Changxin.
